Phoenix Picturehouse

Contact Us

Phoenix Picturehouse, Oxford
57 Walton Street
Oxford
OX2 6AE

Box Office Number: 0871 902 5736
Email: phoenix@picturehouses.co.uk
General Manager: Martin Langley

Location

Phoenix Picturehouse is located in the heart of Oxford and is easily accessible by public transport.
Address: 57 Walton Street, Oxford OX2 6AE

By Rail

Oxford railway station is a 15-minute walk via Cranham Street. To plan your journey and for up-to-date travel information, please visit the National Rail website

By Bus

We are easily accessible by bus. To plan your journey using public transport, please use the Oxfordshire County Council website

On Foot

Click here to find us at www.streetmap.co.uk

By Car

Please note there is limited parking space in the area. For more information please visit the Oxford City Council website

Box Office

The cinema will open at least 15 minutes before the start of the first film each day.
Our telephone lines are open 9.30am â 8.30pm, seven days a week. Please call 0871 902 5736 (calls cost 10p a minute from a BT landline).
You can book tickets online by clicking on the time of a film.
Admission is subject to our Terms of Admission.

Retired Membership
Available to those who are over 60 and retired. You must bring proof of status to the cinema.

Student Membership
Available to those in full-time or part-time secondary or higher education (age 15+), including mature students. You must bring proof of status to the cinema. Find out more

For full details, and to buy or renew your Membership, call 0871 902 5736 or visit your local Picturehouse.

Terms and Conditions

Direct Debit
Get Three Months Extra Free
Sign up to renew your Membership by Direct Debit and we'll add three extra months to your Membership for free
Complete this Direct Debit Mandate to enable us to renew your Membership on the day after it is due to expire. We will contact you in the month before renewal to remind you of the cost and date of the renewal. Signing up will ensure that your Membership remains current and that you continue to receive all your benefits.

You can cancel your Direct Debit at any time by simply contacting your bank or building society.

Student Membership

Introducing our Â£15 Student Membership
Join to receive free tickets, discounts and much more. It's a no-brainer!

Student Picturehouse Members enjoy the following benefits and discounts:

  • Two free film tickets
  • Up to Â£2 discount on film tickets for a year
  • 10% off the Student Memberâs food and drinks
  • Discounts at all Picturehouse Cinemas nationwide
  • Membership of E4 Slackers Club, which gives you access to free monthly previews
  • Plus additional Membership benefits

Student Picturehouse Membership is available to those in full-time or part-time secondary or higher education (age 15+), including mature students. You need to have valid photo student ID to be eligible.

Full Terms and Condition

Call 0871 902 5736 or visit your local Picturehouse for more details. Buy online now and pick up your new Membership card upon presentation of your NUS or student photo ID card at the cinema.

E4 Slackers Club

Every month E4, in partnership with Picturehouse Cinemas, screens a free film exclusively for students. From previews of the biggest new blockbusters to old-school classics, E4 Slackers Club shows the best movies around.

To become a member, you just need to take your NUS or student photo ID card to any Picturehouse Cinema and sign up for free. If you become a Student Picturehouse Member, you will automatically gain membership of E4 Slackers Club.

Head over to E4.com/Slackers or Facebook for screening dates and competitions.

Students Screen Arts Offer

New for students! Two tickets for Â£10 on Picturehouse Screen Arts shows. See the best in theatre, dance and opera for the measly sum of Â£10, and take a mate with you! Screen Arts brings world-class arts productions to your local cinema, in glorious high definition on the big screen.

Only available on the day of the screening. Tickets must be booked in person. This offer is subject to availability.

Gift Cards

Our Gift Cards can be used to buy anything for sale in any Picturehouse Cinema â whether it's a ticket or two for a cracking film, or a cup of coffee in one of our cafÃ© bars.

They're simple, flexible and top-up-able!

Using Gift Cards at the cinema
You can use your Gift Card to purchase anything for sale. The exact amount will be taken off the card, and any money left over will remain on the card for another time. If there isnât enough money on the card to cover your purchase, just pay by another method. There are no time limits on the card.

Using Gift Cards online
You can use your card to pay for online purchases. When you get to the payment page, change the payment method from Bank Card to Gift Card. Please note that if you want the Gift Card to be enabled for use online, you need to set up a four-digit PIN. You can do this over the phone on 0871 902 5747.

Using Gift Cards over the phone
Simply quote your Gift Card number when making a purchase over the phone. We strongly advise you to set up a PIN.

Silver Screen Club

For the over-60s. Membership is free, and members can enjoy a free tea or coffee and biscuits at the weekly Silver Screen shows. Silver Screen membersâ tickets are Â£5 for Silver Screen shows. Non-members are also welcome â the usual ticket prices apply.

Big Scream Club

For parents and guardians with babies under one year old. Membership is Â£5 and valid until the babyâs first birthday. Tickets are at the Picturehouse Membersâ rate (see above), babies come free. Only customers with babies will be admitted.

Toddler Time

For preschool children and their parents and guardians. Membership is free. Tickets for members are Â£3, free for accompanying adults. The usual ticket prices apply to non-members and their parents. No adult unaccompanied by a toddler will be admitted.

Unemployed

Unemployed people can purchase a ticket at child ticket prices, Tuesday to Thursday before 4.00.

Kids' Club

For children aged three to 12. Membership is Â£4 a year, including the first visit free. Tickets for members and accompanying adults are Â£1.50 each. Non-members and accompanying adults pay Â£4 each. No adult unaccompanied by a child will be admitted.

Autism-Friendly Screenings

All tickets for Autism-Friendly Screenings are Â£3.

Schools' Screenings

Schoolsâ screenings are Â£3.50 per pupil, or Â£4 for premium films. Accompanying teachers come free.
To request information on our schools' programme or to organise a trip, please contact Cinema Plus.

Community Screenings

Â£4 for all tickets.
To request a community group visit to a film in our main programme, please contact the Picturehouse Education department.

3D Screenings

3D films cost Â£2 extra per person, including 3D glasses. If you bring your own glasses, please request a 70p refund at the cinema.

Student tickets are available to those in full-time secondary or higher education.

Retired tickets are available to those over 60 who are retired.

Child tickets are available to those under 15.

Family tickets are for four people, at least two of whom must be under 15. Not applicable to premium-price screenings.

You may be asked for proof of age, which needs to be photographic ID with date of birth. Suitable proof includes a passport or a CitizenCard (details of which are available from the Box Office).

There is a Â£1.50 booking fee per transaction for telephone and online bookings. This fee does not apply to Picturehouse Members,* or to tickets purchased in person at the cinema.

*Includes Silver Screen and Slackers Club members, as well as paid-for Memberships.

Disabled Access

This page explains the current facilities for people with disabilities, and is intended to assist you in planning your visit.

Advance booking
Planning your visit in advance is always a good idea so that our staff can readily provide assistance if required. Accompanying carers are eligible for a free ticket. We will be pleased to reserve wheelchair spaces or seats in any particular part of the auditorium if this is helpful. Please contact us in advance.

Customers with Limited Mobility
Both auditoria are accessible to customers with limited mobility, including wheelchair users. Please note wheelchair spaces are limited. There is a lift in the foyer to help wheelchair users with the change of level from the foyer to the corridor that accesses both auditoria. Please ask a member of staff if you would like help with the lift.

We regret that there is no lift access to the first-floor bar. If you would like to take a drink from the bar into the film with you and are unable to use the stairs, please ask a member of staff and your drink will be brought down for you.

Visually Impaired Customers
Guide dogs are welcome. If you wish to take your dog into a performance, please let us know when booking so that we can arrange an aisle seat. Our staff will be happy to provide drinking water for your dog.

Customers with Impaired Hearing
Certain performances carry subtitles, and these are clearly indicated in the programme.

Toilets
There is an adapted toilet for wheelchair users, which is accessible from the main cinema foyer. There is an emergency call point (the red hanging cord) inside should you need to summon assistance.

Carers

Customers who have a disability that means that they need a companion with them in the cinema can bring them to any Picturehouse Cinema for free.

You can sign up for a Carers Card which will automatically discount one of your tickets, and which you can use â without a booking fee â when buying tickets in person, online or by telephone. The card will also mean that you donât have to explain your situation every time you visit the cinema.

Ticket prices for customers with disabilities are according to their circumstances (e.g. adult, Member or student); the free ticket applies to their companion. The card must be used in conjunction with a paid-for ticket or a Memberâs free ticket.

Signing up for a card is not required, but we hope it will make buying tickets easier. It is personal to you, and may not be used by other people.

To apply for an annual Carers Card, visit any of our cinemas, call us on 0871 902 5747, or email customerservice@picturehouses.co.uk

Food and Drink

Our small but perfectly formed first-floor bar is the ideal setting for the heated debate that often follows a great movie.

We offer a fantastic range of wines, locally sourced craft beers and premium spirits, all served by our enthusiastic and welcoming staff. We also run occasional wine and film nights, as well as our unmissable Phoenix Film Quiz on the last Monday of every month.

If you are looking for a venue with a twist, the bar can be hired for private functions. We regularly host birthday parties, wedding receptions and corporate events.

For more information on bookings, email phoenix@picturehouses.co.uk
